(4) Axway [https://www.axway.com] Catalysts [https://catalysts.axway.com]

  • Small team of experts in the digital transformation and API space
    • Help customers to make good decisions on their API journey
    • Move the community of API practitioners and their practices forward
  • Team members are distributed globally

From APIs to Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Perspectives on API Development in Public Administration

(6) APIs are Languages [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wDYeU2T4v2o&list=UUDD75qoXHJSz4pv0o3WcTUw] and Promises [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gFu7CQKmBeQ&list=UUDD75qoXHJSz4pv0o3WcTUw] (for Machines)

  • An API is a Language [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wDYeU2T4v2o&list=UUDD75qoXHJSz4pv0o3WcTUw]
    • Two applications can communicate (within or across organizational boundaries)
    • Other applications can start using it because the language is well-defined
  • An API is a Promise [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gFu7CQKmBeQ&list=UUDD75qoXHJSz4pv0o3WcTUw]
    • A promise to provide services for programmatic access
    • A promise to keep the language stable for as long as possible


From APIs to Platforms Erik Wilde (@dret): Perspectives on API Development in Public Administration

Start Small but Think Big

Start Small but Think Big Erik Wilde (@dret): Perspectives on API Development in Public Administration

(11) How APIs Drive Value

  • Platforms drive value in the digital economy and society
    • An increasing number of capabilities become digitally enabled
    • The growing number of digital building blocks support new value chains
  • Three places where new value is created
    1. Allowing others to start engaging in value co-creation
    2. Creating valuable new experiences for users of the platform
    3. Bringing existing capabilities into the digital realm as new building blocks


Start Small but Think Big Erik Wilde (@dret): Perspectives on API Development in Public Administration

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Perspectives on API Development in Public Administration

(15) Creating Citizen Value

  • Think and plan about cultivating a growing and evolving ecosystem
  • Always think about supporting the creation of new value
  • Always keep in mind that co-creation is a powerful amplifier


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Perspectives on API Development in Public Administration
